basics.name: Eric Farr
basics.label: Technologist and Team-Builder
basics.summary: Technologist and team-builder leading software organizations to build market-driven solutions and reach the highest levels of performance. Delivering Software-as-a-Service solutions at scale, specializing in HTML5, mobile, predictive analytics, Microsoft .NET, and agile methods.

work.summary: Lead development and IT operations for leading machine learning based predictive analytics delivered to the insurance industry as a service (SaaS)
highlights: Modernized tech stack from Silverlight, WCF, ADO.NET and TFS to HTML5, WebAPI, MVC, Entity Framework, Git, TeamCity, and Octopus Deploy.
Reduced monthly IT spend by 40%.
Reduced system errors by 75% in first six months.
More than doubled development team output.
Delivered major new release users and sales team rave about. Sales presentations moved from all PowerPoint to all software demo.

projects.name: Maintain and Enhance Talon Analytics Workbench

work.summary: Led development of Web and Mobile field service automation applications delivered as a service (SaaS)
highlights: Delivered distributed, event-based, service-oriented SaaS platform for field service automation on .NET platform with NServiceBus and RavenDB (NoSQL) to replace aging system that had scaling limits.
Led development of on/off-line iOS & Android mobile clients in HTML5.
Grew Engineering team five-fold in two years with no attrition.
Introduced Scrum and agile practices of TDD and Domain Driven Design.

work.summary: Led development of Agentek’s flagship mobile workforce optimization product.
highlights: Transitioned Engineering from waterfall development on proprietary technology to agile methods (iterative and incremental development, pair programming, continuous integration, and behavior-driven development) on .NET framework and HTML5.
Replaced custom-build approach with componentized product.
Helped sales team close deals ranging from $50k to $300k.
Led training of client IT teams in integration to our systems.
Oversaw complex integration projects.

work.summary: Helped build leading agile product development management solution, delivered as a service.
highlights: Contributed as member of a high-performing software team developing the leading project planning and management tool designed specifically for agile software development.
Coded in C# 3.0, ASP.NET, DHTML, JavaScript, and AJAX with Subversion, ReSharper, and Cruise Control.

work.summary: Led development of low-level components that enabled OpenSpan software to integrate with otherwise closed applications. Reverse-engineered third party and operating system components.
Led transition from waterfall to agile and Delphi to .NET.
highlights: Led transition of development organization from legacy COM/DCOM, client/server development to the Microsoft .NET platform.

Bootstrapped .NET development effort (SCM strategy, continuous build, application architecture, etc.). Within a year, shipped no-touch deployed smart client, revolutionizing the corporate check-capture market.

work.summary: Architecture lead for strategic sourcing product.
highlights: Led migration of C++ based CGI application to .NET platform with Managed Extensions for C++, ASP.NET, C#, XML, and Web Services.
Architect and development lead for a Strategic Sourcing product.

work.summary: Worked as a contact programmer in various capacities for various companies.
highlights: Developed a graphical SQL query builder, complete with SQL syntax parser (Visual C++, ActiveX/COM, ATL, VB, SQL, and Lex & Yacc).
Device driver design, development, and optimization to Diamond Multimedia, Binar Graphics, STB Systems, and IBM.
Redesigned a multi-chip, multi-OS driver architecture improving performance and reducing development time.

Developed a technique for calling real-mode BIOS interrupts from protect- mode OS/2. Involved creation of virtual-8086 session, a task switch to it, the software interrupt call, and a switch back to protect mode—all in a physical device driver.

projects.name: Binar Graphics: Display Drivers for OS/2
Ernst & Young: International Tax Calculation Engine

highlights: Awarded 'Volunteer of the Month'
